u act like people havent played both and prefer one to the other. long games are more satisfying to win, and dont feel like u got fuckin robbed by snowball bullshit when u lose

I feel like this is happening more and more often, maybe 2/10 games are a challenge, the rest are horribly one sided.

>
> dont feel like u got fuckin robbed by snowball bullshit when u lose

Snowball "bullshit" is when this game is most fair. If more of your teammates lose their lanes/objectives they lose the game. The teams with the players who are more skilled at their champion have an advantage and can push to win. I won't dare say the game is balanced right now, with early game monsters in top and late game gods in bot despite being an early game meta. I DO prefer winning a 20 min game because we pushed our lead instead of losing a 47 min game where we did everything we could but {{champion:115}} waveclear combined with {{champion:57}} {{champion:29}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:33}} means they just turtle until they outscale and win because of their PICK and not because of their skill.
I mean, this is essentially a tower defense game, defending is an important skill, too many people forget that

> [{quoted}](name=Lios Ashenblade,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XiIEYpGb,comment-id=000200000000000100010000,timestamp=2018-01-14T15:09:30.391+0000)
>
> defending is an important skill

Agreed, but there is a limit. If you're losing that hard, you shouldn't be able to simply turtle and not get smashed. Everyone has the metas they enjoy, right now people who don't enjoy losing (and being outskilled by their opponents) cry for longer games so they can scale. When the meta inevitably shifts to that like it always does toward the end of the season no doubt the boards will be crying for shorter games.

We lost this match the other day, but it was still probably the most fun I have had in league in a while... we were way behind, I was on teemo... they had middle inhib turret down, so I just spam shroom the entire base...like 2-3 feet apart, everytime they try and come in, explosions everywhere, we win the trade 5 for 4... then  5 for 3...2.. in the end they got a perfect initiate and killed 2 carries, and steam rolled right through my shrooms and beat us, but it was hilarious

Thats where picking proper champions in a proper team comp that can then tower dive late instead of just getting wavecleared comes in  tanks go in draw tower agro while assassins or mages kill squishies  and adcs rip tanks over some time. Only way you just get wavecleared when you have advantage early is if your team is too scared to push their advantage or you picked 2 assassins 2 mages one adc team comp

So...
If an early game champion wins lane and never has to experience the late game where they fall off against their opponent it's skill, but if a late game champion manages to survive the early game champion's advantage and scale despite not having much of any tools in their kit to do so it's not?

That's not an argument, I can use that same statement against you.

Longer games at least include strategy being viable, not just "smash face on keyboard and win"
There's no correlation between the length of  a game and the match quality.

I just won an 18 minute game (last night). By taking the nexus. Backed twice I think. Held off the entire team and took nexus with my adc while mid jungle and top were still taking t1/t2 towers in their lanes.

I miss competitive games as well.

at that point people just sit out their lane and forget about playing as a team because you a literally waiting for a win/lose coming 10..9..8..

i mean the botlane is 8 kills + fb turret up 

game is over at that point is see people no longer bothering to participate in anything but their lane after that because they lost all agency anyway

Yes, it's more difficult make a comeback, but not a majority of the games that reached that time before where because an intense and fierce fight between two balanced teams. Just one struggling and the other straight bad at closing.

I'll admit, I've had 4- 45-55 minute games in the last couple days and I hated every one of them. (I won 3)

I don't like games being decided at 10 minutes, but I like them over by 45.

I just find it way more exciting to play a full build champ (usually a glass cannon mage for me) and feeling my entire kit pack a punch.  I even stand a good chance against tanks if they don't manage to flank me as my cc is at its peak with shortest cooldowns and I almost always build a Liandry's.

It just feels good playing in the full late game (6 items + Elixir).
I always have this lategame fanstasy when i queue to play {{champion:163}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:61}} of me using a game-changing rank 3 ult. Then the game ends when im level 12.
I think long wins feel better but long losses feel worse. Your mileage may vary.

Good meme @everyone downvoting other’s opinions that don’t coincide with their own. I do not like extremely long games but I also hate extremely short games. There needs to be a balance of an average game length of about 30-35 mins. Not absurdly long but not short. If most of my games were 50 mins each day, it would be seriously tedious to play this game, so hopefully that never becomes a thing again.
No offense but that is kinda the point of the vote system. To upvote what you agree with and downvote what you don't.

Oh, see that? You only down voted because you disagreed with my opinion. You probably didn't even look at the rest of my post LOL. I guess the vote system does have to deal with that but when its just a bunch of people constantly down voting other's opinions who may or may not be right, it's a little oppressive.

Opinions aren't meant to be wrong or right, and yes I downvoted your post because I disagree.
If someone says 30 minute games are more fun, that can't be proven right or wrong, its an opinion.

Actually I didn't downvote your post. There is no reason to take votes so personally anyway. And opinions can't be right or wrong but that won't stop people from upvoting one they agree with and down voting ones they don't. It has nothing to do with correctness only someone else's opinion. But since you seem to care so much have a down vote.

Seriously ?
Having often 47 minutes game is awful

30 minutes game are fine, what's not fine is them being total stomp-fest.

Trying to balance late game being at 30 minutes, when late game used to be 50 minutes means that it is always going to be a stomp fest.  They can't just compress time, balance changes that shorten the length of the game make the game more snowbally.  You don't WIN quicker without someone LOSING faster.
I think Riot realized that people don't want to be tactful or strong but want to feel tactful and strong.

Personally, I'm not a fan of games that last more than 30 minutes. Whether it's preference or rose-tinted glasses from nostalgia, I just found it way too stressful when everything you did becomes pointless and it all comes down to a single mistake since death timers are so long. Nothing made me want to stop playing League more than spending 40+ minutes in a match only to lose because a teammate or myself made a wrong play, got caught out, or just getting unlucky then watching the enemy team march down mid.
but the game now becomes pointless when you make a mistake at the 20 minute mark...

I'm just talking purely from a time and effort standpoint, where losing a game that lasts 40+ minutes can sometimes make you feel like you just spent an hour or even longer doing something pointless. I'm sure the same can be argued for 20 minute matches, too.

Basically, Loss Aversion.
